alert.note: Alert for Adams; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 8:37PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN ADAMS AND WEST CENTRAL SCIOTO COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 837 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Peebles, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... West Union, Peebles, Blue Creek, Rarden, Otway, Dunkinsville, State Route 348 at State Route 125, Wamsley and Cedar Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
